intro: Sarcostigma paniculatum var. angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved sarcostigma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically less than 2 cm wide. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, often in pink or white hues. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. This variant is distinguished by its narrower foliage compared to other varieties within the species.
